alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 5:25PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Marion and northern Lamar Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 525 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Amory, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Sulligent, Detroit, Beaverton, Weston, Crews, Gattman, Henson Springs, Shottsville, Rankin Fite Airport, Byrd, Pine Springs, Bexar, Marion County Public Lake and Pikeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Birmingham.
